title: Requires counting affidavit ballots of eligible voters if a voter appears at a polling place in the correct county but in the incorrect election district
summary: Requires the counting of an affidavit ballot of an eligible voter if such voter appeared at a polling place in the correct county but in the incorrect election district.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1325

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 6, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by Sens. DILAN, DIAZ, HASSELL-THOMPSON, PARKER -- read twice
         and ordered printed, and when printed to be committed to the Committee
         on Elections

       AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to counting  of  affidavit
         ballots

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph (iii) of paragraph (a)  of  subdivision  2  of
    2  section 9-209 of the election law, as amended by chapter 104 of the laws
    3  of 2010, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (iii)  If the board of elections determines that a person was entitled
    5  to vote at such election, the board shall cast and canvass  such  ballot
    6  if  such  board finds that the voter appeared at [the correct] A polling
    7  place IN THE CORRECT COUNTY, regardless of the fact that the  voter  may
    8  have appeared in the incorrect election district.
    9    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02923-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to counting of affidavit ballots
